summary.span: 表示键/值对的集合，这些键值对按键排序并可按照键和索引访问。

span.span: Represents a collection of key/value pairs that are sorted by the keys and are accessible by key and by index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此集合的泛型版本，请参阅。For the generic version of this collection, see . 一个元素可以通过其密钥，像在任何元素访问实现中，或通过其索引，像在任何元素实现。A element can be accessed by its key, like an element in any implementation, or by its index, like an element in any implementation. 一个对象在内部维护两个数组来存储的列表; 即，键的一个数组元素和另一个数组中的关联值。A object internally maintains two arrays to store the elements of the list; that is, one array for the keys and another array for the associated values. 每个元素都是可作为访问键/值对对象。Each element is a key/value pair that can be accessed as a object. 密钥不能为`null`，但可以是一个值。A key cannot be `null`, but a value can be. 容量对象是元素数目可以容纳。The capacity of a object is the number of elements the can hold. 元素添加到，自动增加容量通过重新分配所需的方式。As elements are added to a , the capacity is automatically increased as required through reallocation. 可以通过调用减少容量或通过设置属性显式。The capacity can be decreased by calling or by setting the property explicitly. 对于非常大对象，可以通过设置增加到 20 亿元素在 64 位系统上的最大容量`enabled`到的配置元素的特性`true`在运行时环境中。For very large objects, you can increase the maximum capacity to 2 billion elements on a 64-bit system by setting the `enabled` attribute of the configuration element to `true` in the run-time environment. 元素对象进行排序的键按照特定时指定实现是创建或根据密钥本身提供实现。The elements of a object are sorted by the keys either according to a specific implementation specified when the is created or according to the implementation provided by the keys themselves. 在任一情况下，不允许重复的键。In either case, a does not allow duplicate keys. 索引序列基于排序顺序。The index sequence is based on the sort sequence. 当添加一个元素时，它将插入到中正确的排序顺序和对索引进行相应调整。When an element is added, it is inserted into in the correct sort order, and the indexing adjusts accordingly. 删除元素后，索引也相应地调整。When an element is removed, the indexing also adjusts accordingly. 因此，特定的键/值对的索引可能会更改元素在添加或删除从对象。Therefore, the index of a specific key/value pair might change as elements are added or removed from the object. 上的操作往往速度要慢于上的操作对象由于排序的对象。Operations on a object tend to be slower than operations on a object because of the sorting. 但是，可通过在相关的键或索引，从而对值的访问提供更大灵活性。However, the offers more flexibility by allowing access to the values either through the associated keys or through the indexes. 可以使用整数索引访问此集合中的元素。Elements in this collection can be accessed using an integer index. 在此集合中的索引都是从零开始的。Indexes in this collection are zero-based. `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each`在 Visual Basic 中) 返回集合中的元素的类型的对象。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual Basic) returns an object of the type of the elements in the collection. 由于每个元素的对象是一个键/值对，元素类型不是键的类型或值的类型。Since each element of the object is a key/value pair, the element type is not the type of the key or the type of the value. 相反，元素类型是。Rather, the element type is . 例如：For example: [!code-cpp[Classic SortedList Example#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList Example/CPP/remarks.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[Classic SortedList Example#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList Example/CS/remarks.cs#2)] [!code-vb[Classic SortedList Example#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList Example/VB/remarks.vb#2)] `foreach`语句是允许仅读取，不写入集合的枚举器周围的包装。The `foreach` statement is a wrapper around the enumerator, which allows only reading from, not writing to, the collection. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何创建和初始化对象以及如何打印出其键和值。The following code example shows how to create and initialize a object and how to print out its keys and values. threadsafe.span: 公共静态 (在 Visual Basic 中) 的此类型的成员是线程安全。

span.span: Public static ( in Visual Basic) members of this type are thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 但不保证所有实例成员都是线程安全的。

span.span: Any instance members are not guaranteed to be thread safe.

threadsafe.span: 一个对象都可以支持多个读取器并发，只要不修改该集合。

span.span: A object can support multiple readers concurrently, as long as the collection is not modified.

threadsafe.span: 若要保证的线程安全，必须通过返回的包装器完成所有操作方法。

span.span: To guarantee the thread safety of the , all operations must be done through the wrapper returned by the method.

threadsafe.span: 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。

span.span: Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.

threadsafe.span: 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。

span.span: Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception.

threadsafe.span: 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。

span.span: To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class that is empty, has the default initial capacity, and is sorted according to the interface implemented by each key added to the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 每个密钥必须实现接口，才能使用中的所有其他密钥的比较的对象。Each key must implement the interface to be capable of comparisons with every other key in the object. 对元素进行排序依据添加到每个键实现。The elements are sorted according to the implementation of each key added to the . 容量对象是元素数目的可以容纳。The capacity of a object is the number of elements that the can hold. 元素添加到，自动增加容量所要求的重新分配内部数组。As elements are added to a , the capacity is automatically increased as required by reallocating the internal array. 如果可以估计集合的大小，指定的初始容量，则无需要执行多个大小调整操作，同时将元素添加到对象。If the size of the collection can be estimated, specifying the initial capacity eliminates the need to perform a number of resizing operations while adding elements to the object. 此构造函数是 o （1） 操作。This constructor is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建使用集合不同构造函数，并演示的集合的行为差异。The following code example creates collections using different constructors and demonstrates the differences in the behavior of the collections. remarks.format: ## Remarks 对元素进行排序按照指定实现。The elements are sorted according to the specified implementation. 如果`comparer`参数是`null`，则使用的每个键实现; 因此，每个密钥必须实现接口，才能使用中的所有其他密钥的比较的对象。If the `comparer` parameter is `null`, the implementation of each key is used; therefore, each key must implement the interface to be capable of comparisons with every other key in the object. 容量对象是元素数目的可以容纳。The capacity of a object is the number of elements that the can hold. 元素添加到，自动增加容量所要求的重新分配内部数组。As elements are added to a , the capacity is automatically increased as required by reallocating the internal array. 如果可以估计集合的大小，指定的初始容量，则无需要执行多个大小调整操作，同时将元素添加到对象。If the size of the collection can be estimated, specifying the initial capacity eliminates the need to perform a number of resizing operations while adding elements to the object. 此构造函数是 o （1） 操作。This constructor is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建使用集合不同构造函数，并演示的集合的行为差异。The following code example creates collections using different constructors and demonstrates the differences in the behavior of the collections. remarks.format: ## Remarks 根据选择，显式或默认情况下，比较器确定插入点时创建对象。The insertion point is determined based on the comparer selected, either explicitly or by default, when the object was created. 如果已等于，则容量的自动重新分配内部数组中，可以增强对象和现有元素之前添加新元素将复制到新数组。If already equals , the capacity of the object is increased by automatically reallocating the internal array, and the existing elements are copied to the new array before the new element is added. 此外可以使用属性来添加新元素，通过设置密钥的值中不存在对象 (例如， `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`)。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the object (for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`). 但是，如果中已存在指定的键，并设置属性将会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the , setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反，方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. 元素对象进行排序的键按照特定时指定实现是创建或根据密钥本身提供实现。The elements of a object are sorted by the keys either according to a specific implementation specified when the is created or according to the implementation provided by the keys themselves. 密钥不能为`null`，但可以是一个值。A key cannot be `null`, but a value can be. 此方法为 O (`n`) 操作对于未排序数据，其中`n`是。This method is an O(`n`) operation for unsorted data, where `n` is . 它是 O (log `n`) 操作，如果在列表的末尾添加了新元素。It is an O(log `n`) operation if the new element is added at the end of the list. 如果插入导致大小调整，运算复杂度为 O (`n`)。If insertion causes a resize, the operation is O(`n`). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何将元素添加到对象。The following code example shows how to add elements to a object. remarks.format: ## Remarks C# 语言的 `foreach` 语句（在 Visual Basic 中为 `for each`）隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有固定大小的集合不允许添加或删除元素的集合创建，但允许修改现有元素后。A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but does allow the modification of existing elements. 具有固定大小的集合只是一个集合与防止添加和移除元素; 的包装器因此，如果在更改基础集合，包括添加或删除的元素，大小固定集合反映了这些更改。A collection with a fixed size is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents adding and removing elements; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, including the addition or removal of elements, the fixed-size collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要保证的线程安全对象，必须通过返回的包装器完成所有操作方法。To guarantee the thread safety of a object, all operations must be done through the wrapper returned by the method. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何锁定集合使用属性在整个枚举期间。The following code example shows how to lock a collection using the property during the entire enumeration. remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以使用属性来访问集合中的特定元素通过指定以下语法： `myCollection[key]`。You can use the property to access a specific element in a collection by specifying the following syntax: `myCollection[key]`. 此外可以使用此属性来添加新元素中不存在的键的值设置对象 (例如， `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue)`。You can also use this property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the object (for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue)`. 但是，如果中已存在指定的键，并设置属性将会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the , setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反，方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. 密钥不能为`null`，但可以是一个值。A key cannot be `null`, but a value can be. 来区分`null`因为找不到指定的键返回并`null`返回指定键的值是因为`null`，使用方法或方法以确定在列表中存在该密钥。To distinguish between `null` that is returned because the specified key is not found and `null` that is returned because the value of the specified key is `null`, use the method or the method to determine if the key exists in the list. 元素按照键排序按照特定时指定实现是创建或根据密钥本身提供实现。The elements of a are sorted by the keys either according to a specific implementation specified when the is created or according to the implementation provided by the keys themselves. C# 语言使用关键字来定义而不是实现索引器属性。The C# language uses the keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the property. Visual Basic 将 实现为默认属性，该属性提供相同的索引功能。Visual Basic implements as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality. 检索此属性的值是 O (log `n`) 操作，其中`n`是。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(log `n`) operation, where `n` is . 将属性设置为 O (log `n`) 操作，如果键已存在于。Setting the property is an O(log `n`) operation if the key is already in the . 如果键不在列表中，将属性设置为 O (`n`) 操作的未排序的数据或 O (log `n`) 如果在列表的末尾添加了新元素。If the key is not in the list, setting the property is an O(`n`) operation for unsorted data, or O(log `n`) if the new element is added at the end of the list. 如果插入导致大小调整，运算复杂度为 O (`n`)。If insertion causes a resize, the operation is O(`n`).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 索引序列基于排序顺序。The index sequence is based on the sort sequence. 当添加一个元素时，它将插入到中正确的排序顺序和对索引进行相应调整。When an element is added, it is inserted into in the correct sort order, and the indexing adjusts accordingly. 删除元素后，索引也相应地调整。When an element is removed, the indexing also adjusts accordingly. 因此，特定的键/值对的索引可能会更改元素在添加或删除从对象。Therefore, the index of a specific key/value pair might change as elements are added or removed from the object. 在由连续的元素组成的集合（如列表）中，已移除元素下面的元素将上移以占据空出的位置。In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot. 如果集合具有索引，则移动的元素的索引也将更新。If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated. 此行为不适用于元素按概念划分为不同存储桶的集合，如哈希表。This behavior does not apply to collections where elements are conceptually grouped into buckets, such as a hash table. 此方法为 O (`n`) 操作，其中`n`是。This method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is . ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何从元素移除对象。The following code example shows how to remove elements from a object. [!code-cpp[Classic SortedList.RemoveAt Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList.RemoveAt Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic SortedList.RemoveAt Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList.RemoveAt Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic SortedList.RemoveAt Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList.RemoveAt Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

span.span: Returns a synchronized (thread-safe) wrapper for a object.

returns.span: 对象的同步（线程安全）包装。

span.span: A synchronized (thread-safe) wrapper for the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要保证的线程安全对象，必须通过此包装器完成所有操作。To guarantee the thread safety of a object, all operations must be done through this wrapper only. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何锁定集合使用属性在整个枚举期间。The following code example shows how to lock the collection using the property during the entire enumeration. [!code-cpp[Classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example/CPP/source2.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[Classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example/CS/source2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[Classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example/VB/source2.vb#2)] 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation. 下面的代码示例显示了如何同步对象，确定是否同步的以及如何使用同步。The following code example shows how to synchronize a object, determine whether a is synchronized, and use a synchronized . [!code-cpp[Classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要创建的同步的版本对象，请使用方法。To create a synchronized version of the object, use the method. 但是，派生的类可以提供其自己的同步的版本使用属性。However, derived classes can provide their own synchronized version of the using the property. 同步代码必须在执行操作的，而不是直接在。The synchronizing code must perform operations on the of the , not directly on the . 这样可确保对从其他对象派生的集合正确地执行操作。This ensures proper operation of collections that are derived from other objects. 具体而言，它维护与其他线程可能同时对修改的正确同步对象。Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the object. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何锁定集合使用属性在整个枚举期间。The following code example shows how to lock the collection using the property during the entire enumeration. [!code-cpp[Classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example/CPP/source2.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[Classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example/CS/source2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[Classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_Classic/classic SortedList.IsSynchronized Example/VB/source2.vb#2)] 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks [Visual Basic、 C#][Visual Basic, C#] C# 语言的 `foreach` 语句（在 Visual Basic 中为 `for each`）隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置，调用将引发异常。At this position, calling throws an exception. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，则调用将引发异常。If the last call to returned `false`, calling throws an exception. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 如果集合修改之间并，返回设置为时，该元素，即使该枚举数已经无效。If the collection is modified between and , returns the element that it is set to, even if the enumerator is already invalidated. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation.
